messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Principal interrupts Valedictorian
messages.msgSnippet: I forwarded his speech to my DH and titled the email, the best graduation speech ever. It had what seemed to be some (gasp!) original thought, passion, and
messages.messageBody:
I forwarded his speech to my DH and titled the email, "the best
graduation speech ever." It had what seemed to be some (gasp!) original
thought, passion, and insight, and it took GUTS to get up there and
deliver it. SOMEONE has to speak these truths. Maybe it will snap some
of his peers out of the "sheeple" ways of living.

-Vijay

On Jul 2, 2006, at 3:42 PM, Ren Allen wrote:

> ~Mainland, Elnahal said, does
> not encourage intellectual thought and the exchange of ideas.~
>
> I'm cheering wildly for this bright and brave young man!
> Visionaries have to do uncomfortable and outrageous things sometimes
> or the world will never change. Good for him.
>
> Ren
> learninginfreedom.com
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Principal interrupts Valedictorian
messages.msgSnippet: ~Mainland, Elnahal said, does not encourage intellectual thought and the exchange of ideas.~ I m cheering wildly for this bright and brave young man!
messages.messageBody:
~Mainland, Elnahal said, does
not encourage intellectual thought and the exchange of ideas.~

I'm cheering wildly for this bright and brave young man!
Visionaries have to do uncomfortable and outrageous things sometimes
or the world will never change. Good for him.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
